rComments: She is by far the best LALS professor I've had and learned the most from! The kind of prof. that makes a difference. She uses a variety of teaching methods in lecture to keep students engaged, makes herself available, goes the extra mile to help her students, and she's funny. It is definitely worth taking a class with her. A great prof. isn't easy!

She is a very knowledgeable and passionate professor in her field of study. Brought presenters from unions and other countries as well. The class is a little tough since there are 500 word weekly reading responses, a midterm, a final and a final 10 page paper. Fairly well class overall.

Professor Gleeson was very knowledgeable of the topic and provided the class with guest speakers who talked about their experiences organizing unions through collective action. She was also accessible for office hours  for whenever a student had any problems or questions regarding lecture material. An A is possible if you read and attend lectures.

Easy class, I got an A without reading any of the material.  Obviously the workload will be high if you actually read, but there's no point since she covers all the important info in lecture.  25% of your grade is essentially free points and she states herself that her midterm/final should be simple.  No work, easy A, good choice for GE, etc.

A lot of work for a lower division class, would not recommend taking if you aren't interested in the subject-matter. She curves her test, which is nice. Assigns a lot of material, but it's not dense so it's a pretty quick read. My biggest complaint is that her power points have a lot of spelling errors
Good professor overall but work is pretty tough. Lot of material to learn but interesting.She's helpful if you are lost.

I HATE THIS CLASS! She is extremely educated, but assigns a lot of busy work/writing. Assignments that take a LONG time are worth very little points. Not a good class to take if only in it for a G.E. Hard to have any interest b/c there is so much material/reading and you feel like you aren't learning anything. Not an easy A if you aren't invested.

This professor. So far, she is being so difficult. She has no tolerance for excuses or laziness, which is a good thing to a certain extent. She comes off as unapproachable, well at least for me. She moves super fast but reviews a lot. A lot of guest speakers. However, she is so vague when it comes to her assignments.  So vague.

Clear and straightforward professor. Heavy reading load, lots of busy work. Multiple choice midterm and final (review study guide), 10 page research paper. Do all assigned work and you'll end up with an A or B, depending on how you do on exams.

Professor Gleeson was a perfectly fine teacher, though I would've liked a little less busy work with all those damn readings and subsequent reading responses. It was just her subject that bored me exceedingly, though I should've thought of that before taking a whole class on labor movements.

Shannon's a very motivated teacher, maybe even a little overzealous. She assigns a lot of busy work (thick $50 reader)--but if you are good at multiple choice (for the midterm/final) it is an easy A class. Not really enjoying it though, can't figure out why??
